Very Brief Testimony
content.p:
Was a sinner, now a saint (you said brief). Seriously though, I grew up in church all my life, had great Christian parents, but I never had a personal relationship with Christ. I took what little I knew about God and the Bible and tested it to life. I was a pleasure seeker and ultimately was not fulfilled in the world. I found out how much I didn't measure up to God's standard when I started reading the bible. I gave my life to Christ on August 31, 1999 after reading some scripture.
I went church seeking, and even visited Calvary Chapel, but decided since I was so "church" cultured, not to attend church immediately. I grew a little and when I was ready, a friend invited me to Calvary. It was almost a year to the date since I last visited. I liked the Bible study and knew this is where God wanted me.
content.heading: Favorite Book of the Bible and Why
content.p: Psalms - The Psalmist goes through real struggles and really expresses and experiences God in a way that is real to me. It speaks to me when I'm in tribulations and it encourages me through them.
content.heading: Favorite Verse and Why
content.p:
Philippians 1:21 For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.
It's my favorite because it is so focused. It's a mentality I wish to be consistent in, and yet fall short so many times. But man... to be able to live that verse is awesome.
content.heading: Favorite Book (besides the Bible) and Why
content.p: The Next Generation Leader by Andy Stanley, because it is so encouraging and practical at the same time.
content.heading: Who do you most admire (besides Jesus)
content.p: Dead: Oswald Chambers. Living: My Dad.
